fi.grimripper.loww.movement

Class MovementMode

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.grimripper.loww.movement.MovementMode
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultMovement

    public abstract class MovementMode
extends java.lang.Object
    The base class for movement modes. Contains the public interface, as well as utilities for subclasses. Utilities include handling of obstacles, events, blocks and movement modifiers, as well as managing movement data. Each movement mode has a base movement value, which determines how many tiles the host can move in case the movement cost for each tile is one.

    Each tile has a specific terrain type, which determines the base move cost in that tile. Each tile can have any number of obstacles, which may or may not affect movement. An obstacle can make a tile impassable, or affect movement cost in another way.

    Each tile can also include any number of events, which can prevent a mobile object from entering or leaving a tile. Events are tested during movement radius generation. The movement search can't progress further than an event which prevents movement. When the mobile object moves, tile events get executed, and may block movement even if they previously claimed to allow movement.

    Blocks can alter move costs between tiles. Their effects can change depending on direction and mobile object, unlike those of an obstacle. Movement modifiers can affect any of the above properties. They can alter the cost of terrain, enable the host to ignore obstacles, events and blocks, as well as modify the final move cost which includes terrain, obstacles and blocks.

    Author:
    Marko Tuominen
    See Also:
    Block, MobileObject, MovementEvent, Obstacle

      • IMPASSABLE_MOVE_COST

        public static final int IMPASSABLE_MOVE_COST
        Movement cost which makes a tile impassable by default. Higher cost is also impassable. The limit cost for impassability can be altered.

      • calculateOccupyHeight

        public Height calculateOccupyHeight(Tile mainTile,
                           Direction facing)
        Calculates the occupy height for a main tile and facing. Terrain determines base occupy height, which obstacles and movement modifiers can increase. Doesn't perform any checks to see if it's possible to occupy the given template, except that the template must be fully within the tile grid in order to calculate the occupy height.
        Parameters:
        mainTile - template main tile
        facing - facing in the tile
        Returns:
        occupy height for the given main tile and facing

      • calculateOccupyHeight

        public Height calculateOccupyHeight(Tile... template)
        Calculates the occupy height for a tile template. Terrain determines base occupy height, which obstacles and movement modifiers can increase. Doesn't perform any checks to see if it's possible to occupy the given template, except that height can't be calculated if there are nulls in the template.
        Parameters:
        template - template tiles
        Returns:
        occupy height for the given template

      • movementRadius

        public abstract void movementRadius(int totalMove)
        Generates movement radius for the host mobile object.
        Parameters:
        totalMove - the mobile object's total movement

      • getMovementPath

        public abstract Tile[] getMovementPath(Tile pathTo,
                     Direction facing)
        Creates a mobile object's movement path to a particular tile. The path array doesn't contain the mobile object's starting tile (it's location before moving). Instead, the first tile in the path array is the one where the host moves from the starting tile. After that, the path progresses from tile to tile until the last tile in the array contains the destination tile, which was given as a parameter. In case the given tile isn't within the movement radius, the array is empty. An empty array is also returned for a null destination and if the current location and destination are the same.
        Parameters:
        pathTo - find movement path to this tile
        facing - facing in the destination tile
        Returns:
        the path to the given tile

      • executeMovementPath

        public abstract Tile[] executeMovementPath(Tile destination,
                         Direction facing)
        Executes a mobile object's movement from its current location to a destination. Starting from current location, executes movement events for each tile along the path. If movement is interrupted, places the mobile object in a suitable position along the path. Returns the path the mobile object moved. If the mobile object is forced to backtrack because of an interruption, the path ends at the tile the mobile object ends up occupying.

        Regardless of movement direction, the mobile object can always turn in place at its destination. In case of interruption, facing is towards the next tile on the movement path. The movement mode should remove the host from its current location before movement and set the final location and facing after movement.

        Parameters:
        destination - the destination tile
        facing - the host's facing in the destination tile
        Returns:
        the path of tiles the mobile object moved through (includes the destination tile, but not the starting tile); empty array if the host failed to move at all, or null if the destination was unreachable in the first place

      • addEventToBuffer

        public void addEventToBuffer(MovementEvent event,
                    Tile tile)
        Adds a movement event to a buffer, which is executed after the mobile object enters a tile.

        This buffer is meant to prevent events from getting executed if enter events stop the mobile object from entering the tile where the events reside. It's also helpful for repeating a single event, or getting the event executed only once, even if it's located in multiple tiles which the mobile object enters at the same time.

        All movement events are executed normally once, and can interrupt movement. The buffered events are executed after the mobile object enters the tile, so at the second execution they can't interrupt movement. The events can be ignored by movement height or modifiers on the first execution, and then won't get a chance to add themselves to the buffer. The buffer can also be used during movement radius generation for risk calculation.

        In order to get an event executed only once, it can take effect the first time, add itself to the buffer, and then do nothing once it has been buffered. In order to get the event executed only if and when the mobile object actually enters the event's tile, the event can be buffered on the first execution. In order to get an event executed only once and only if the host enters the tile, it can be added on the first execution, and if executed multiple times, checked that it isn't already in the buffer.

        Parameters:
        event - add event
        tile - add event to tile (passed to the event when it's executed later)
        See Also:
        getBufferedEvents(), isEventBuffered(MovementEvent, Tile), isEventBufferExecuting(), removeEventFromBuffer(MovementEvent, Tile), getEventBufferRisk(Height), executeEventBuffer(Height)

      • isEventBuffered

        public boolean isEventBuffered(MovementEvent event,
                      Tile tile)
        Checks if an event has been added to the buffer. The check also works while the events are being executed. New events can't be added during execution, but the ones that were added before execution can be checked.
        Parameters:
        event - check if event is buffered
        tile - check if buffered event is in this tile (anywhere if null)
        Returns:
        event is buffered
        See Also:
        addEventToBuffer(MovementEvent, Tile), isEventBufferExecuting()

      • getBufferedEvents

        public MovementEvent[] getBufferedEvents()
        Gets currently buffered movement events, if any.
        Returns:
        currently buffered movement events (null while executing)
        See Also:
        addEventToBuffer(MovementEvent, Tile)

      • removeEventFromBuffer

        public MovementEvent removeEventFromBuffer(MovementEvent event,
                                  Tile tile)
        Removes an event from the buffer. Events can't be removed while the buffer is executing.
        Parameters:
        event - remove this event
        tile - remove event associated with this tile (any tile if null)
        Returns:
        the removed event, null if nothing was removed
        See Also:
        isEventBufferExecuting()

      • isEventBufferExecuting

        public boolean isEventBufferExecuting()
        Checks if tile events are being executed from the buffer. Allows enter tile events to take effect only when the mobile object actually enters a tile, not if other tile events prevent it from entering. Movement events can't be added to the buffer while it's being executed.
        Returns:
        the event buffer is being executed
        See Also:
        addEventToBuffer(MovementEvent, Tile), isEventBuffered(MovementEvent, Tile)

        Returns:

      • getImpassableMoveCost

        protected int getImpassableMoveCost()
        Gets the movement cost which is treated as impassable. Any values higher than this are also treated as impassable.
        Returns:
        minimum move cost which makes a tile impassable

      • getTerrainCost

        protected float getTerrainCost(Terrain terrain)
        Gets move cost of a terrain type with changes from movement modifiers. Terrain costs are saved, and re-calculated only when movement modifiers are added or removed. The terrain costs can be explicitly cleared in order to have them calculated again.
        Parameters:
        terrain - get cost for this terrain
        Returns:
        cost for the given terrain, with modifiers
        See Also:
        clearTerrainCosts()

      • createTileData

        protected MovementMode.TileData createTileData(Tile forTile)
        Gets movement data for a tile, creating a new object if necessary. This data is tile-specific, and a tile can only have one instance of it. The tile data is kept until movement radius is cleared.
        Parameters:
        forTile - get movement data for this tile
        Returns:
        the movement data for the tile, possibly a new object
        See Also:
        clearRadius()

      • getAndSaveCost

        protected float getAndSaveCost(Tile tile,
                   Height height)
        Adds changes from obstacles and modifiers to terrain move cost and saves it. This's the cost of a single tile, templates must be considered separately. Also, doesn't include costs from blocks, since they depend on moving direction. Height also affects cost, so cost is saved separately for different heights. If movement height is higher than the terrain's height, terrain cost is ignored and a default of one is used. Obstacle costs are then added.
        Parameters:
        tile - calculate movement cost at this tile
        height - movement height, ignores obstacles lower than this
        Returns:
        movement cost at the given tile and the given height
        See Also:
        MovementModifier.modifyTerrainCost(Terrain, float), addObstacleCosts(Tile, Height, float)

      • addObstacleCosts

        protected float addObstacleCosts(Tile tile,
                     Height height,
                     float cost)
        Applies obstacles to a tile's move cost, as well as obstacle changes from modifiers.
        Parameters:
        tile - the tile whose obstacles are added
        height - the host's movement height
        cost - cost without changes from the obstacles
        Returns:
        cost with obstacles and related modifiers
        See Also:
        MovementModifier.modifyObstacleCost(Tile, Obstacle[], float)

      • addBlockCosts

        protected float addBlockCosts(Tile from,
                  Tile to,
                  Height minHeight,
                  Height moveHeight,
                  float cost)
        Applies blocks to a cost, as well as block changes from modifiers. Block costs aren't saved.
        Parameters:
        from - the tile which the host is leaving
        to - the tile which the host is entering
        minHeight - the host's minimum movement height
        moveHeight - actual movement height with terrain
        cost - cost without changes from blocks
        Returns:
        cost with blocks and related modifiers
        See Also:
        Block.modifyMoveCost(Tile, Tile, MobileObject, Height, float), MovementModifier.modifyBlockCost(Tile, Tile, MobileObject, Height, Block[], float)

      • blocksAllowTemplate

        protected boolean blocksAllowTemplate(Tile[] template,
                          Height height)
        Checks if blocks prevent movement when a template is partially on one side of the block and partially on the other. Each block in each template tile needs to be checked. Movement modifiers can ignore blocks, and blocks below movement height are ignored.
        Parameters:
        template - the host's template tiles
        height - the host's movement height
        Returns:
        blocks allow the template to be placed at the given tiles
        See Also:
        Block.allowsTemplate(Tile, MobileObject, Height, Tile[])

      • getMinimumHeight

        protected Height getMinimumHeight(boolean occupy,
                      Tile... template)
        Gets minimum movement or occupy height for the host mobile object, without terrain. Obstacles and movement modifiers can increase minimum height, and any terrain, obstacles, blocks and events below minimum move height will be ignored. Terrain height is not included here, because being partially on flat terrain, and partially on shallow terrain, for example, will not allow the mobile object to ignore the shallow terrain's effects. Terrain height also doesn't allow ignoring obstacles or events. For actual movement and the effects of events and blocks, terrain height is used. If nothing affects movement height, the default is deep. For occupy height, obstacles can't be ignored, and movement modifiers may handle height differently.
        Parameters:
        occupy - true for occupy height, false for movement
        template - get minimum movement height for this template
        Returns:
        minimum movement height with obstacles and modifiers (null if template is partially outside the tile grid)

      • getTerrainHeight

        protected Height getTerrainHeight(Height minHeight,
                      Tile... template)
        Gets minimum occupy or movement height for the mobile object, including terrain. The mobile object can't move below the height of the terrain. This is separate because terrain doesn't allow ignoring anything below its height, but obstacles and movement modifiers do. Terrain height or higher should be used for actual movement height.
        Parameters:
        minHeight - minimum movement height without terrain
        template - the host's template tiles
        Returns:
        highest terrain height in the tiles, or parameter height if it's higher

      • canOccupy

        protected boolean canOccupy(Tile tile,
                Direction facing,
                Height height)
        Checks if a position can be occupied at a given height, including obstacles, blocks and movement modifiers in the whole template. Saves whether or not the tile can be occupied with this facing, and uses the saved data on subsequent calls. Tiles which are already occupied by an obstacle (excluding the host) may not be occupied under any circumstances, and the same goes for any position where the template is partially outside the tile grid.

        Calculates the tile's move cost, saving it and using saved tile data when possible. An impassable tile can't be occupied by default, but movement modifiers can allow it. Blocks must also allow occupation, and they can't be overridden by movement modifiers. Occupy data for blocks is not saved because they depend on too many variables.

        Parameters:
        tile - check if this tile can be occupied
        facing - facing while occupying
        height - occupy height
        Returns:
        the position can be occupied
        See Also:
        getAndSaveCost(Tile, Height)

      • canBeOccupied

        protected boolean canBeOccupied(Tile tile,
                    Direction facing)
        Checks saved occupy data to determine if a specific position can be occupied.
        Parameters:
        tile - occupy this tile
        facing - facing in the tile
        Returns:
        can occupy
        See Also:
        getOccupyHeight(Tile, Direction)

      • getOccupyHeight

        protected Height getOccupyHeight(Tile tile,
                     Direction facing)
        Gets previously saved occupy height for a specific tile and facing.
        Parameters:
        tile - get occupy height for this tile
        facing - get occupy height for this facing
        Returns:
        occupy height, null if can't occupy or not set, also for facing directions that aren't suitable for the template
        See Also:
        setOccupyHeight(Tile, Direction, Height)

      • calculateOrGetOccupyHeight

        protected Height calculateOrGetOccupyHeight(Tile tile,
                                Direction facing)
        Calculates or gets occupy height for a specific tile and facing. If height is already set, returns that height. Otherwise calculates occupy height, and checks that the position can be occupied. If it can't, saves a null height to indicate this.
        Parameters:
        tile - set occupy height for this tile
        facing - set occupy height for this facing
        See Also:
        calculateOccupyHeight(Tile, Direction), canOccupy(Tile, Direction, Height), setOccupyHeight(Tile, Direction, Height)

      • setOccupyHeight

        protected void setOccupyHeight(Tile tile,
                   Direction facing,
                   Height height)
        Sets occupy height for a specific tile and facing, as well as symmetric facing directions.
        Parameters:
        tile - set occupy height for this tile
        facing - set occupy height for this facing
        height - occupy height, null if can't occupy

      • setOccupyHeightForPosition

        protected void setOccupyHeightForPosition(Tile tile,
                              Direction facing,
                              Height height)
        Sets occupy height for a specific tile and facing.
        Parameters:
        tile - set occupy height for this tile
        facing - set occupy height for this facing
        height - occupy height, null if can't occupy

      • testEnterEvents

        protected float testEnterEvents(Tile moveTo,
                    Height minHeight,
                    Height moveHeight)
        Determines if movement events allow entering and calculates risk. This's a test for a single tile, not a template. Risks are tested once for each movement event in the tile. In addition, events that are added to the event buffer can be re-tested later. The buffer allows events to repeat themselves, but also to prevent the same event from being checked multiple times for multiple tiles entered at the same time.
        Parameters:
        moveTo - execute enter events in this tile
        minHeight - bypass events beneath this height
        moveHeight - actual movement height with terrain
        Returns:
        negative if events prevent entering, otherwise the events' total risk
        See Also:
        MovementModifier.getProtectionAgainstEvent(MovementEvent, Tile), MovementEvent.canEnterTile(MobileObject, Tile, Height), MovementEvent.getRisk(MobileObject, Tile, Height), addEventToBuffer(MovementEvent, Tile), isEventBuffered(MovementEvent, Tile)

      • testLeaveEvents

        protected boolean testLeaveEvents(Height height,
                      Tile... moveFrom)
        Checks if movement events within a template allow the host to leave its current location. Always returns true if movement events are ignored. Also checks initial tiles. Events in any of them can't prevent leaving. Sets the given tiles active before checking.
        Parameters:
        height - bypass events beneath this height
        moveFrom - test if the host can move further from this location
        Returns:
        events allow the host to leave the given tiles
        See Also:
        MovementModifier.getProtectionAgainstEvent(MovementEvent, Tile), MovementEvent.canLeaveTile(MobileObject, Tile, Height)

      • executeEnterEvents

        protected boolean executeEnterEvents(Height minHeight,
                         Height terrainHeight,
                         Tile[] eventsAt,
                         int[] tileIndices)
        Executes enter events for a group of tiles during movement. Events below movement height don't get executed and modifiers can also ignore events.
        Parameters:
        minHeight - ignore movement events below this height
        terrainHeight - actual movement height with terrain
        eventsAt - execute enter events for these tiles
        Returns:
        events allow entering
        See Also:
        MovementModifier.getProtectionAgainstEvent(MovementEvent, Tile), MovementEvent.enteringTile(MobileObject, Tile, Height)

      • executeLeaveEvents

        protected boolean executeLeaveEvents(Height minHeight,
                         Height terrainHeight,
                         Tile... eventsAt)
        Executes leave events for a group of tiles during movement. Events below movement height don't get executed and modifiers can also ignore events.
        Parameters:
        minHeight - ignore movement events below this height
        terrainHeight - actual movement height with terrain
        eventsAt - execute leave events for these tiles
        Returns:
        events allow leaving
        See Also:
        MovementModifier.getProtectionAgainstEvent(MovementEvent, Tile), MovementEvent.leavingTile(MobileObject, Tile, Height)

      • getEventBufferRisk

        protected float getEventBufferRisk(Height height)
        Calculates total risk for all movement events in the event buffer. The buffer is cleared after the calculation.
        Parameters:
        height - the host's movement height
        Returns:
        total risk for buffered events
        See Also:
        addEventToBuffer(MovementEvent, Tile), MovementEvent.getRisk(MobileObject, Tile, Height)

      • executeEventBuffer

        protected void executeEventBuffer(Height height)
        Executes all enter tile events in the event buffer. The buffer is cleared after execution. The events can't interrupt movement at this point, so there's no return value.
        Parameters:
        height - the host's movement height
        See Also:
        addEventToBuffer(MovementEvent, Tile), MovementEvent.enteringTile(MobileObject, Tile, Height)

      • clearEventBuffer

        protected void clearEventBuffer()
        Clears all movement events in the event buffer. The event buffer is cleared after executing the events in it, or calculating risk from them. It should be explicitly cleared when movement radius generation continues to another tile without calculating risk for the buffered events, or when the host moves to a different tile without the events being executed. Otherwise the buffered events will carry on to the next tile.

      • isIgnored

        protected boolean isIgnored(Obstacle obstacle,
                Height height)
        Checks if an obstacle can be ignored. Movement modifiers allow ignoring obstacles, and they can also be crossed over at a sufficient movement height.
        Parameters:
        obstacle - check if this obstacle can be ignored
        height - movement height (deep prevents ignoring because of height)
        Returns:
        obstacle can be ignored
        See Also:
        Obstacle.getTotalHeight(), MovementModifier.ignoresObstacle(Obstacle)

      • getProtectionAgainst

        protected int getProtectionAgainst(MovementEvent event,
                       Tile tile,
                       Height height)
        Checks if a movement event can be ignored completely, or if it can't interrupt movement. It might not affect movement radius generation or movement, but can still cause a risk and get executed during movement. Movement modifiers can also make events completely ineffective so that they can't cause a risk and are not executed.
        Parameters:
        event - a movement event
        tile - the tile where the event is located
        height - the host's movement height
        Returns:
        negative if movement event is unaffected, zero if it can't interrupt movement or positive if it's completely ignored and can't cause a risk or get executed

      • isIgnored

        protected boolean isIgnored(Block block,
                Tile from,
                Tile to,
                Height height)
        Checks if a block can be ignored. Movement modifiers allow ignoring blocks, and they can also be crossed over at a sufficient movement height.
        Parameters:
        block - check if this block can be ignored
        from - the tile which the host is leaving
        to - the tile which the host is entering
        height - movement height (deep prevents ignoring because of height)
        Returns:
        block can be ignored
        See Also:
        Block.getHeight(Tile), MovementModifier.ignoresBlock(Block, Tile, Tile, Height)
